title: How to Make Jjajangmyun Black Bean Noodles

steps.headline: Stir-fry the pork belly in a large, deep wok with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.
steps.description: Fry for about 4 to 5 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.

steps.headline: Pour out the excess pork fat.
Add radish and stir fry for 1 minute.
Add the potato, onion, and zucchini.
steps.description: Keep stirring for about 3 minutes, until the potato looks a little translucent.

steps.headline: Clear a space in the center of the wok by pushing the ingredients to the edges.
Add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the center of the wok, then add ¼ cup of black bean paste.
steps.description: Stir it with a wooden spoon for 1 minute, to fry it. Then mix everything in the wok and keep stirring.

steps.headline: Add  2 cups of water to the wok.
steps.description: Let it cook with the lid closed for about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Open the lid and taste a sample of the radish and potato.
steps.description: If they’re fully cooked, stir in the starch water little by little. Keep stirring until it’s well mixed and thick.

steps.headline: Add the sesame oil and remove from the heat.
Serve with noodles (jajangmyeon) or steamed rice (jjajangbap).

text: Stir-fry the pork belly in a large, deep wok with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Fry for about 4 to 5 minutes, until golden brown and crispy. Pour out the excess pork fat.  Add radish and stir fry for 1 minute.  Add the potato, onion, and zucchini. Keep stirring for about 3 minutes, until the potato looks a little translucent. Clear a space in the center of the wok by pushing the ingredients to the edges.  Add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the center of the wok, then add ¼ cup of black bean paste. Stir it with a wooden spoon for 1 minute, to fry it. Then mix everything in the wok and keep stirring. Add  2 cups of water to the wok. Let it cook with the lid closed for about 10 minutes. Open the lid and taste a sample of the radish and potato. If they’re fully cooked, stir in the starch water little by little. Keep stirring until it’s well mixed and thick. Add the sesame oil and remove from the heat.  Serve with noodles (jajangmyeon) or steamed rice (jjajangbap).  Finished.
